title: Some Dietary Supplements May Be More Than a Waste of Money | NutritionFacts.org
author: Michael Greger M D FACLM
description: People taking dietary supplements may, in some cases, be paying to make themselves sick. This video covers folic acid, beta carotene, and green tea supplements.
cleaned_text: People taking dietary supplements may, in some cases, be paying to make themselves sick. This video covers folic acid, beta carotene, and green tea supplements. Some Dietary Supplements May Be More Than a Waste of Money Doctor's Note This is the final video of a three-part series with the latest information on the safety of dietary supplements. For the first two, see [Dietary Supplement Snake Oil](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/dietary-supplement-snake-oil), and [Heavy Metals in Protein Powder Supplements](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/heavy-metals-in-protein-powder-supplements/). For background on the folic acid versus folate story (which may explain any multivitamin/breast cancer connection), see [Can Folic Acid Be Harmful?](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/can-folic-acid-be-harmful/) For more on avoiding esophageal cancer, see [Poultry and Penis Cancer](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/poultry-and-penis-cancer/); [Coffee and Cancer](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/coffee-and-cancer/); and [Bacon and Botulism](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/bacon-and-botulism/). For how to boost your absorption of carotenoid phytonutrients (like beta [Forego Fat-Free Dressings?](https://nutritionfacts.org/video/forego-fat-free-dressings/) Pretty scary about green tea supplements, but green tea has a variety of health-promoting properties. Check out my [other videos on tea.](https://nutritionfacts.org/topics/tea/) For further context, check out my associated blog posts: [ Plant-Based Workplace Intervention]( https://nutritionfacts.org/2013/01/29/vegan-workplace-intervention/); [Avoid Cooked Meat Carcinogens](https://nutritionfacts.org/2013/07/04/avoiding-cooked-meat-carcinogens/); and [Probiotics and Diarrhea](https://nutritionfacts.org/2013/12/26/probiotics-and-diarrhea/). To see all of my newest videos on supplements, visit the [topic page](https://nutritionfacts.org/topics/supplements).
